Through the power of the Maw, the Ogres can sustain themselves with any type of food, including the earth itself.
As the Ogre hordes move from place to place, their enemies find themselves starved of resources before the coming storm.
Khorne holds nothing but intense hatred for all kinds of magic or sorceries.
Khorne exalts most highly those who never rest in their bloodshed even as their own endurance begins to falter.
Arbaal is a raging bloodthirsty warlord, yet his enemies are often given a chance to prepare and become greater challenges to be crushed in Khorne's name.
The Blood God personally watches the most notable conflicts, his wrathful aura warping everything into a state of frenzied, perpetual strife.
Wherever the Destroyer of Khorne passes through, mobs of fanatic reavers spring forth like blood from a mortal wound, drowning any survivors in violence and murder.
Like a raging hurricane, Khorne's most favoured Champion sweeps across the Old World, raking everything asunder.
As long as Arbaal continues to prove his worth, Khorne is willing to send his most favoured Champion additional troops under his banner.
[[i]]"All ya need’s a coupla boyz to hold dem still an' da riderz'll go round an' smash 'em!"[[/i]]
[[i]]"Dere's no worryin' 'bout wasted arrers when ya got gobbos out dere ta fetch dem back for ya."[[/i]]
[[i]]"Da Trolls do da smashin' betta if ya send da boyz out dere wiv dem."[[/i]]
[[i]]"Send in enuff big Spiderz an' da little ones come out to feast as well!"[[/i]]
[[i]]"Nuffin' like some gobbos cheerin' all togetha to get da Boss up for a fight!"[[/i]]
[[i]]"Keep ya friends close, an' yer Wyverns closa – ya neva know when ya need to set dem loose."[[/i]]
[[i]]"Get da grim boyz ta line up propa! Nuffin can get past dem or stop 'em!"[[/i]]
[[i]]"Dere ain' no betta warrior an' no betta Warboss dan me!"[[/i]]
[[i]]"We got all dese Wolves an' Boars sittin' around doin' nuffin! Get dem ta work so we can get ta fights quicka!"[[/i]]
[[i]]"Fer fasta wagonz, let da Snotlings 'ave summa dat gobbo Mad Cap brew before dey go."[[/i]]
[[i]]"Get da Big 'Uns side by side ta shake da ground! Let dem gitz try ta take 'em down if dey can't even stand up straight!"[[/i]]
[[i]]"An 'ungry Giant’z no good to ya, but gobbo-fodda's all ya need ta keep dem fed."[[/i]]
[[i]]"Load dem grim boyz wiv all da best and 'eaviest armour so da ground shakes wiv every stomp!"[[/i]]
[[i]]"One Squig’s gonna be murda, but a group of dem’s a bloodbarf!"[[/i]]
[[i]]"Da Divers don’t always know where dey’s flyin, so let da Wolf Riders show dem da way."[[/i]]
[[i]]"Der ain’t nothin' scarier to da enemy dan when da night gobbos're drunk on Hag fungus!"[[/i]]
[[i]]"Get da sneaky gobbos an' dem wood-livin' gitz ta set up sum propa traps over dere!"[[/i]]
[[i]]"Da cave gobbos know da way, but let da Big 'Uns do da diggin'."[[/i]]
[[i]]"Oi, 'and ova yer smoke bombs to da real fighty boyz!"[[/i]]
[[i]]"Da dumb Trolls keep gettin' distracted an' wonderin' off! Stick wiv 'em an' keep 'em focused on da smashin'!"[[/i]]
[[i]]"Don't waste meat on da beasts, let 'em get dere fill on da battlefield!"[[/i]]
[[i]]"When usin' Boar Boyz for line-smashin', da Orc Boss knows da best wayz."[[/i]]
[[i]]"Just pour a buncha grease over sum Squigs an' let dem loose – da fire arrers'll do da rest."[[/i]]
[[i]]"Keep jabbin' da boyz wiv da bad juice an' dey get used to it soon enuff."[[/i]]
[[i]]"Put da Idolz to work on da Lobberz and watch dem rocks fly!"[[/i]]
[[i]]"While I'm on da field, ain't nuffin' gettin' past me. I've always gotta plan!"[[/i]]
[[i]]"Give a gobbo a net an' he'll slow da enemy gitz down long enuff to stick 'em fulla arrers."[[/i]]
[[i]]"Just leave it to me an' da boyz!"[[/i]]
[[i]]"We gotz da biggest Waaagh! Channel dat power in yer chantin'!"[[/i]]
[[i]]"There ain't no betta lootin’ to be had den when da Wolf Riders are on da prowl!"[[/i]]
[[i]]"No such thing as too many Bosses – coz if da orders ain't obeyed, someone's 'ead'z gettin' smashed!"[[/i]]
[[i]]"Yer nevva gonna get a betta killin' den when da arrers are flyin' an' da Lobberz are lobbin'!"[[/i]]
[[i]]"With da help of da Shaman, da night gobbo archers ain't too shabby at snipin'."[[/i]]
[[i]]"When nothin' but a massive 'splosion’ll do, get da Shamans to blow up da biggest Squig yoov got."[[/i]]
[[i]]"Get dem spearz pointin' in all directions an' stick any who gets close to ya!"[[/i]]
[[i]]"A bitta River Troll bile makes da Arrer Boyz all da more dangerous!"[[/i]]
[[i]]"Match yer dancin' wiv da Shaman'z! I wanna see da ground shakin' an' tremblin'!"[[/i]]
[[i]]"Da savage boyz ain’t da sneakiest, but give dem a Skulker to show dem where to go, an' dey'll be sneakin' up on da gitz in no time!"[[/i]]
[[i]]"Yoo can neva 'ave too many Spiderz! Da more you 'ave, da more gitz get snagged in dere webz!"[[/i]]
These colonies are bound to the sea, their quays laden with provisions and stores, streamlining the vast upkeep of Ulthuan’s Dragonships.
Every port swells with levies of trade and tithe, their gathered wealth sustaining Dragonships whose prows bear Elven wrath abroad.
Here the riches of outposts are tallied and exchanged, the flow of silver and craft lifting the prosperity of all Asur colonies.
With burdens eased, new colonies rise swiftly, their white stones and silvered banners carrying Ulthuan’s splendour to distant shores.
With Sea Guard entrenched, quivers swell and volleys quicken, their mailed presence steadying both the field of war and the realm beyond.
With each post the tally grows: spice and wine, fur and herb, rendered into wealth by keen tariffs and the Elven gift of order.
With musters established, Asur colonies raise regiments once bound to Ulthuan alone, their wars abroad fed by conquest and the spoils it yields.
Asur colonies grow apace, their halls and harbours raised swiftly, extending the reach of Ulthuan’s brilliance with unmatched efficiency.
Forged in myth and tempered at sea, the Dragonblades extend the Dragonship’s might, striking terror as keenly as steel upon flesh.
Dragonship sails, bright as dawn, sweep the horizon, their enchantments lending new swiftness and vision to Asur fleets abroad.
Sanctums of rest and recovery bind the wounds of war, ensuring Dragonship hosts replenish swiftly and stand ready once more.
The high cabin of the Sea Lord becomes the fleet’s mind, a sanctum of command from which heroes are appointed and learning advanced.
In these vast holds are stored the wealth and wargear of Ulthuan, their ordered stockpiles lowering the cost of campaign and levy alike.
Ammunition is tallied, drills rehearsed, and new hands blooded, raising the muster’s rank and tempering every cohort into hardened steel.
With supply burdens lessened, Dragonship crews swell rapidly, their stores well-stocked and every deck teeming with seasoned hands.
Another Dragonship joins the fleet – a rare boon of naval supremacy, its admiral’s presence bolstering every army under Ulthuan’s banner.
Engines of keen precision, wrought by Vaul and manned by sharp-eyed crews, the Eagle Claw ensures no raider closes unscathed.
The presence of a Sea Helm brings order to the outpost; each command, crisp as salt wind, rallies warriors to face the foe unbowed.
With each colony the sea lanes grow brighter, for where the Asur raise white walls and slender towers, trade and warding magic follow.
These treasuries balance the scales of commerce and conquest, where merchant’s gain and warrior’s prize alike enrich the Asur realms.
Where the High Elves raise marbled courts and shaded halls, vigour is renewed and discipline steadied, and the land itself bends toward harmony.
Where Sea Guard keep vigil, discipline prevails; their presence steadies the Asur host and leaves little room for an enemy’s intrigue.
These branches weave Ulthuan’s provinces closer, their gleaming halls hosting envoys whose silvered words extend harmony abroad.
The growth of Outposts brings plazas, towers, and walls of alabaster, their reach extending Ulthuan’s grace to distant shores.
The Elven aim is always true, they say. But the harm it will do us is as false as Loec's promises to those who worship him – and as false as his arrogance.
The bow of Loec's lowly deceit drawn, arrows loosed, only to be turned aside by the one who brooks no deceit. This shall be the first inkling of his failure.
The trickster godling prides himself on letting shadows take his enemies' blows for him. Chaos magic does not discriminate – first it shall fell his shadows. Then, him.
Mundane form means nothing in the fleshless realms, yet there we feel in full the luxuriant touch of the Winds. How less affectionate they shall be as they catch Loec's scent!
In hollow hope, the capering godling will look back at his hunter's lolling tongue and imagine him tired. It is but our Prince's beauteous leer, guiding Loec to his final trap.
The predator's step slows, his flanks tremble – is he about to pounce? As Loec's uncertainty grows, so shall his pursuer's appetite swell with the feast to come.
Pain is a meal consumed through the skin. It is our Prince's milk, and ours. There are other, more rarified savours that he has saved for Loec, who so loves his "feasts".
We let ourselves be touched, so we may be pursued. It is how our master will toy with the Shadow Dancer. But in godly games of merriment and cruelty there was only ever one winner.
In the end, our Prince will lay his palm on Loec's shoulder, and whisper a greeting in his ear. Neither running nor struggle will serve. Only servitude.
When the Prince has his last dance, Loec will pray for the power to refuse. Yet does a god who prays not offer his essence for another to sup on?
In the end, Loec's mask of shadow-dappled leaves will fall away – underneath it, there was never strength. His laughter will cease. Without it, there was never a voice.
In the end, the pursuit will stop when Slaanesh decides. Loec will know there was never an escape – the path only ever led to the cage, now open, waiting.
Poor Loec the Lost. Is he here, or is he there? He is nowhere. In the void.
In the eye of oblivion, hulking size is but a speck. Hurtling speed is stillness. Unlike our adversaries' brutish troupes, we know it.
The dance of all that is will end in nothing, and so we must give all of ourselves by forsaking the conceits of safety.
If we take our cue from others in this performance, we may as well cut off our legs. To lead this dance, we will shear off the others' legs, if need be.
We will forgive our dancing partners' hurtful infelicitous form. There is no time to teach them. But stay still and our feet will be trodden upon through our own fault.
The Winds wither like the leaves in winter. Would this be how the end begins?  This uncertainty may haunt the sweep of our steps, yet in that there is beauty also.
The great will dance to the last – until they stagger in the murky twilight, footing lost, no feet to dance with. But not yet.
The elemental essence of desire, from which our Prince has made us, will be unmade in the end. After that, the dissolution of others may feed our curiousity.
In the final moments, with no eyes to see with and no bodies to propel us, we shall catch a glimpse of all that is no more and sense the greater presences amongst our kind.
When the Winds are no more, their last withered gusts will harden and fold into matter, and fall. We will chart our dance's course around the blades of air.
When the seas dry, essences will break all souls, their vessels, and spill in fiery tides that we alone can withstand.
When there is nothing left to feed any fire, one will keep burning still, made of what is left of us – the children of Chaos – and we will dance across the void to set it ablaze.
When earthly matter breaks into primeval clay, and breaks again and again, it will become a deathly wind saturated in magic.
And then there will be no more dancers and no stage. A memory of destruction turning on itself again and again.
Let brutish flailing fists land in our embrace – for it is a viciously clawed one, and we will let fly the blood they love so much!
The frailty of slender blades belies their sharpness. And we are as sharp as we are slender.
The Khornates' spittlesome fervour provides an edge to their lowliest zealots... Zeal is crass for our tastes, but we have edges to spare.
Naked and exposed, our Prince burst forth from unformed Chaos into his perfect form despite the Hound's murderous ministrations. We revere both His gleeful spite and the urgency of His emergence.
In shapeliness of form and sharpness of claw we far outdo the hordes of Khorne. Now see us caper, mimicking their mindless madness!
Battle lust is the only kind Khorne's curs are capable of. Our palette is much wider. But if it is battle lust they want, by the Prince, they shall have it!
The ravening red hordes bolster their form with muscle and steel. The substance of our desire for excess may be ethereal, but it is inexorable… insurmountable!
No deliverers of pain are more insistent in their worship than the Hound's brutes. Among those who receive pain – and return it – none are more devoted than we are.
Minds bent on bloody destruction - and you clothe yourself in cowardly accoutrements of "safety". When those are shed, what is left? Nothing.
Flights of fury, wing-borne thirst for blood... But we have caught wind of you, and fashioned it into a chain. Rattle it all you want. It will be you who will break first.
Blood fuels Khorne's base fires for a time. That which is imbibed fans flames beyond one's capacity to comprehend.
Running away from battle is death, is it not, Khornates? And pressing on, though battered, is your bitter claim to glory… No. It is also death.
Once begotten, Slaanesh will never cease. Such is desire. We carry but a glimmer of it, but it is enough to spark an endless urge that Khorne's red-jowled baying cannot hope to stop.
First, the crass stolidity of rotting roots shall be replaced by glimmering forbiddings so as to preserve us...
First, the malicious stinging vines shall be made pliable at our approach, gentle yet unyielding...
First, careful steps will usher us into the garden, sheathed in the surety of the Dark Prince's protection…
First, we will wreathe ourselves in light by which to dance. We will carry the Dark Prince's fire coiled like a serpent as we make our way into the garden.
Next, when we have found our footing, we will seek out places both close and secret. What we lose in strength we will gain in surprise.
The half-formed things crawling in the soil will shiver with pleasure and burst ripely under our regard as we coax their essence into us.
Next, if not with sharp malice, we shall overcome the burgeoning filth grasping at our feet by endless vigour.
We shall savour the Fly Lord's ill intent, and invite his regard – for our Prince will hide and succour us, even as the plague Winds buffet us.
Towards the end, we shall grow bold in our newfound sturdiness. Corrosive gusts and the crazed writhing of sharp, poisonous things will only serve to fan our flames.
Rich with the scent of imminent success, the burning incense will bolster our essence and fill our limbs with crackling ardour, the fuel to our fire.
At last, we will collect the dull coin of death that Nurgle peddles, calling it "life". With fire we will smelt it and remake it into something shining and deathless.
Virulent brutes and pestilential scum alike will stand slack-jawed amidst the maze of our fire-borne forms and shiver to ashes amidst their gardens.
Their hearth blazing around them, banishment the only way out, Nurgle's servants will dance, for the first and last time. Such merriment their shaking, sloughing flesh will serve!
